commit_message:
Validate password during create_user operation

* Validates if password is not NULL
* Validates if password is not all white spaces
* Add test for testing above functionality.

Implements bp create-user-validation.
Fixes bug 999084.

Change-Id: I42c14236fa472eb0af7255952ac5d74545f89920

[{'created': '2013-05-20 14:13:14.000000000', 'message': "Use --managed-save flag to virsh undefine

If a virtual machine has got a managed save image, it is not
possible to delete it using a plain 'virsh undefine' command.
While Nova doesn't use 'managed save', the libvirt-guests
init script or systemd service may have created one if the
user rebooted their host. Thus we devstack should pass the
--managed-save flag to virsh to ensure the VM's removal.

Change-Id: Id9b072a6dceeb4e179d2b6a25bbdfb559c299e95
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Use --managed-save flag to virsh undefine

If a virtual machine has got a managed save image, it is not
possible to delete it using a plain 'virsh undefine' command.
While Nova doesn't use 'managed save', the libvirt-guests
init script or systemd service may have created one if the
user rebooted their host. Thus we devstack should pass the
--managed-save flag to virsh to ensure the VM's removal.

Change-Id: Id9b072a6dceeb4e179d2b6a25bbdfb559c299e95
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2013-05-18 10:03:38.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate to pbr.

openstack.common.setup and openstack.common.version are now in the
standalone library pbr, so all projects using those two should

commit_message:
Migrate to pbr.

openstack.common.setup and openstack.common.version are now in the
standalone library pbr, so all projects using those two should
migrate.

Fixes bug 1179007.

Change-Id: I7ac1c37f0bf148619dffff8f454db05fc192e471

commit_message:
Add wsgi and update other common modules.

- wsgi module is needed to move other middlewares to
keystoneclient/middleware.

Change-Id: I9b19e8e42d97835a8c86e45bc40a817485716949

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-13 12:11:32.000000000', 'message': "Add Middleware for correlation_id

The middleware generates the 'correlation_id' if it is not already
present in the request header. This 'correlation_id' can be used to
enable more effective debugging of requests that span multiple services.

Change-Id: Iac0d5e6d1d303fb35ed2ffcf3ef363932f75872b
Implements: blueprint create-a-unified-correlation-id

Change-Id: Ibc06a5b05b628e0b640e9299c79127ecbf9c684e
"}, {'created': '2013-05-14 10:04:40.000000000', 'message': "Add Middleware for correlation_id

The middleware generates the 'correlation_id' if it is not already present
in the request header. This 'correlation_id' can be used to enable more
effective debugging of requests that span multiple services.

Implements: blueprint create-a-unified-correlation-id

Change-Id: Ibc06a5b05b628e0b640e9299c79127ecbf9c684e
"}, {'created': '2013-05-15 05:56:33.000000000', 'message': "Add Middleware for correlation_id

effective debugging of requests that span multiple services.

Implements: blueprint create-a-unified-correlation-id

Change-Id: Ibc06a5b05b628e0b640e9299c79127ecbf9c684e
"}]
commit_message:
Add Middleware for correlation_id

The middleware generates the 'correlation_id' if it is not already present
in the request header. This 'correlation_id' can be used to enable more
effective debugging of requests that span multiple services.

Implements: blueprint create-a-unified-correlation-id

Change-Id: Ibc06a5b05b628e0b640e9299c79127ecbf9c684e

commit_message:
Fix 'start nova-bm-dnsmasq' hanging.

Dnsmasq was moved into foreground but 'task' was left in the job which
makes upstart block until the main process exits.

Also adding a 1 second post-start, respawn and proper respawn limit.

Fixes bug #1182120

Change-Id: Ifeb31cc269515e6476e2482ac856417b123be447

My intent is to eventually pull in all the tests in test_sql_upgrade into the framework. Would that be acceptable and if so is this something you would like to see in a big bang type of patch or an incremental changes?

Is there something about this framework with pre/post checks that you don't like or is worse than how test_sql_upgrade does things? I think this framework of having plugin points for each migration level and carrying around all of the data fake data is very useful and works better than having specific testcases. Also the opportunistic MySQL, and PostgreSQL CI db usage works well and fits in with how Nova and Cinder test their db migrations for gating.

Would you mind telling me what the id of the rename changeset is? I had a look and there didn't seem to be anything obviously named as such."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-07 21:40:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Adds port of test_migrations.py from Nova

Adds a port of test/test_migrations.py originally from Nova.
This is the framework required for testing against the SQLite,
MySQL and PostgreSQL backends. It currently implements a
snakewalk for SQLite and tests migrations with data for all of
the db backends if support is present and the openstack_citest
database exists for MySQL and PostgreSQL.

Also ports across a patch from Nova for the with_engine decorator.
This is to work around a bug in 0.7.2 migrate which causes
the decorator function to dispose of the engine after it has been used
even if it is only an in-memory sqlite db. And that causes db versioning
set to be lost when setting up the migration tests.

This currently does not include any data migration tests,
but there are other reviews in the queue which add tests. As
requested I have split the changeset up to add a small
number of tests at a time.

Change-Id: Iac517c3f18c47c9574885be533871598b5544cbc

Seems like we are changing from catching sql.NotFound to checking for ref. We didn't have any tests for sql.NotFound before?

Also, have we tested the changes against mysql or postgre?"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-05-02 17:42:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

You are explicitly passing the session object around, but the session object should be scoped to self.  Is this a case of trying to flyweight, and passing all of the context through a method call?  This approach seems likely to cause hard to catch errors."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-05-02 19:01:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

ayoung: i don't really follow any of what you're saying; please read the code again?"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-05-04 01:32:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

commit_message:
Update API on LDAP does not return the result after an update of
the object (Project, User, Group and Role)

Added and enbaled option key in order to make the group optional keys into a tuple.
That will be wanted in the future anyway.

Fixes bug 1117356

Change-Id: Ic85ea884500ca19efe117bcce2d45102040d4681

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-18 09:22:17.000000000', 'message': "Do not require sudo/rootwrap to check for dnsmasq version

The dnsmasq version check does not need root privileges
to run as with low privs it works just fine. As a side
effect, the use of the rootwrapper was causing unit tests
to hung because the execute call in check_version was not
being stubbed out. Weirdly enough this wasn't caught in
a previous Gerrit run; there must be a passwordless sudo
lurking around somewhere in the Gerrit infrastructure.

Fixes bug #1178800

Change-Id: I4d0bd218768eec2439d3907587682ff35884a262
"}]
commit_message:
Do not require sudo/rootwrap to check for dnsmasq version

The dnsmasq version check does not need root privileges
to run as with low privs it works just fine. As a side
effect, the use of the rootwrapper was causing unit tests
to hung because the execute call in check_version was not
being stubbed out. Weirdly enough this wasn't caught in
a previous Gerrit run; there must be a passwordless sudo
lurking around somewhere in the Gerrit infrastructure.

Fixes bug #1178800

Change-Id: I4d0bd218768eec2439d3907587682ff35884a262

subject: Add a sleep with back-off to retries
messages:
[{'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-05-15 20:11:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-05-15 20:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-05-15 20:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The caveat of this fix is that ssh.py is not really exercised buy the tests - given that run_ssh is set to False.
It will be once ssh into the nodes is enabled.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-15 21:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/29285/2/check/gate-tempest-pep8/3333 : SUCCESS in 3m 08s
- http://logs.openstack.org/29285/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/16156 : SUCCESS in 50m 16s
- http://logs.openstack.org/29285/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/15872 : FAILURE in 45m 41s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/29285/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/22656 : SUCCESS in 19m 56s
- http://logs.openstack.org/29285/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum-full/1468 : FAILURE in 50m 32s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-05-16 03:42:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It is a too big delay.

On a VM the guest system boot is very slow, and back-off would lead to too much delay.

Constant 0.5 sec delay is good IMHO.
It is 120 SYN in a minute, 2 SYN/sec."}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-05-16 06:52:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-05-16 06:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Good point, thanks.
I reduced the default retry timeout to 0.5 with backoff=2.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-05-16 07:18:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

0.5+1+2+4+8+16=31.5

Reaching the "SSH age" can be more than 30 second, with virtual hosts.
32 sec wait will be too high.

Here we can 3 ssh connection situation:
- never succeeded
- first try success
- success after complete reboot

IMHO the backoff little bit overkill in this case, even if I like this kind of ideas :)

IMHO we do not need more than 1 sec delay after 30 sec and more then 2 sec at 1 minute.

Do you have to fight with an IDS system ? Or the SYN were annoying when you captured the traffic ?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-16 07:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/29285/3/check/gate-tempest-pep8/3338 : SUCCESS in 3m 41s

commit_message:
Add a sleep with back-off to retries

The current implementation retries on socket error
without a sleep, and on auth error with a fixed
interval sleep. Replacing all with an exp backoff.
Default sleep time set to 1.5, default backoff 1.01.

Fixes bug #1180213
Change-Id: I764f2aa4f2c0f8e04718d69b842a574db7aca936

about this new feature in Nova.

Fix Bug #1181984

So my test verifies raise of exception on step (https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/common/auth.py#L95)
May be we can change previous test by adding strategy value to the cred dictionary(for case with missed tenant) - in such case it will be duplicated checks.'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-03-21 12:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Improve unit tests for glance.common.auth module

Add additional case to the test glance.tests.unit.test.auth.required_creds,
to verify that plugin created without required
credential pieces raises an exception

Fixes: bug #1152009
Change-Id: I3fdd9224173bdb33a9bd2ab348e22675d735099f

commit_message:
Add thin provisioning support checks.

Add a simple check to verify thin provisioning is supported
in the systems current LVM2 version.

Also add a helper to create thin pools.

Change-Id: I1ae3c168b148029a3085be827209f59bc68ca145

wasn't there another review for this? if so, this should --amend onto that review instead of being a new one."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-05-12 20:31:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What is the expected time difference between 
resp, body = self.client.reboot(self.server_id, 'HARD')
and
self.client.wait_for_server_status(self.server_id, 'ACTIVE')
?

What guarantees we will see the intermediate status in a subsequent request ?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-20 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

commit_message:
Fixes bugs in test_server_actions

* This partially solves the bug #1014647,
* Enhances the testing for test_server_reboot_hard
* Enhances test for test_server_reboot_soft

Change-Id: Ibdd73cf98f771d4a80473bca6374597f0b2ae258

commit_message:
baremetal: drop 'prov_mac_address' column

bm_nodes.prov_mac_address is no longer used. So drop it.

Change-Id: I3c7294da8f62581aba8c948171cb02f80cf054ef

[{'created': '2013-05-15 21:50:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add hacking extension to flake8

Include hacking in test-requires and disable any failing tests.
Once failing tests are fixed they can be enabled to gate on them.

Change-Id: Id6a228441ec94d5d0bee1dba05118bb35ecaa001
'}]
commit_message:
Add hacking extension to flake8

Include hacking in test-requires and disable any failing tests.
Once failing tests are fixed they can be enabled to gate on them.

Change-Id: Id6a228441ec94d5d0bee1dba05118bb35ecaa001

commit_message:
Migrate to pbr.

Also, remove the files associated with this that should not be pulled
from oslo-incubator any longer.

Closes bug 1179007

Change-Id: Id2e882837bdde51a60562e8cdd207c7ff0c88a6a
